channel.title: 100 Marathons for PTSD Awareness
channel.itunes:subtitle: Running 100 Marathons in 100 Weeks to Raise Awareness of PTSD
channel.itunes:author: Simon Buckden
channel.itunes:summary: Find out what motivated PTSD sufferer Simon to attempt to run 100 marathons in 100 days and keep up to date with his progress
channel.description: Disagnosed with Post Traumatic Stress Disorder after serving in the armed forces Simon has tried to come to terms with living with this condition. This podcast gives you a no holds barred and very candid view into Simon's world and his amazing challenge to run 100 marathons in 100 weeks. You can follow Simon on Twitter - @100mara100weeks.

item.title: Episode 13 - another tough week
item.itunes:author: Simon Buckden
item.itunes:subtitle: Our second live show on Ustream.tv, made available as a podcast the following day
item.itunes:summary: Follow Simon on Facebook and Twitter via www.raceto100.co.uk. Another hell of week for Simon but he soldiers on. Another marathon completed and he answers some questions from our listeners. Apologies for the quality of the audio this week but we had a few issues with the connection to Romania. It does get better after the first couple of minutes so hang in there!
item.itunes:keywords: romania, marathon, barefoot running, mental health, ptsd, depression, anger, charity, foundation, mental illness, help for heroes, h4h, joggin, marathon training

item.title: Episode 12 - Year 2 of the Challenge!
item.itunes:author: Simon Buckden
item.itunes:subtitle: We are now broadcasting the show live on uStream at 9pm GMT on a Tuesday
item.itunes:summary: Follow Simon on Facebook and Twitter via www.raceto100.co.uk. As it`s a new year we decided to recap on who the 3 of us are and why Simon is doing the 100 marathons in 100 weeks challenge. Simon also talks about why he is in Romania at the moment and what the plans are for the rest of the year and beyond including the Simon Buckden Foundation.
item.itunes:keywords: romania, huaraches, barefoot, marathon, barefoot running, mental health, ptsd, depression, anger, charity, foundation

item.title: Episode 11 - Last Episode of 2011
item.itunes:author: Simon Buckden
item.itunes:subtitle: This week we have a special guest in Simon Blackwell who is the Race to 100 Project Manager
item.itunes:summary: Follow Simon on Facebook and Twitter via www.raceto100.co.uk. Simon and Simon announce the next challenge which will take place in the USA! There is some exciting news about an event that will be taking place in 2012 to help raise funds for the challenge. Simon has some equally exciting news about the 2012 olympics. There is a winner in our Sunwise re-tweet competition and Simon and Simon get all excited when discovering the oldest toilets in Leeds!
item.itunes:keywords: olympics, leukaemia, marathon, barefoot running, mental health, ptsd

item.title: Episode 10 - Marathons 36 and 37
item.itunes:author: Simon Buckden
item.itunes:subtitle: It's been a busy couple of weeks for Simon with radio, TV and newspaper appearances as well as speaking engagements and oh yeah, 2 marathons as well!
item.itunes:summary: Follow Simon on Facebook and Twitter via www.raceto100.co.uk. After a week off from the podcast we have a packed show with updates from Simon on the 2 marathons he has run since the last episode one of which he rates as his 2nd best so far. Simon also talks about the PTSD symptom of addictions.
item.itunes:keywords: drug addiction, alcohol addiction, parkrun, marathon, barefoot running, mental health, ptsd

item.title: Episode 9 - Simon's Back!
item.itunes:author: Simon Buckden
item.itunes:subtitle: After food poisoning kept him in bed (and the bathroom!) last week Simon is back and ready for his next marathon
item.itunes:summary: Follow Simon on Facebook and Twitter via www.raceto100.co.uk. Simon attends Remembrance Sunday, has some words of wisdom for Chris and is raring to get out there and run marathon 36. He also talks about the PTSD symptom "emotional numbness".
item.itunes:keywords: rememberance sunday, luton marathon, barefoot running, , mental health, ptsd

item.title: Episode 8 - PTSD From an Abusive Relationship - Interview
item.itunes:author: Simon Buckden
item.itunes:subtitle: PTSD can occur for many reasons. This week we interview a very brave lady who suffered domestic abuse.
item.itunes:summary: * YOU MAY FIND THIS EPISODE VERY UPSETTING * Follow Simon on Facebook and Twitter via www.raceto100.co.uk. Simon ends up in hospital with food poisoning and the lack of sleep means his PTSD symptoms rear their ugly head. He is not able to record the podcast so we have an extended interview with a very brave lady who has PTSD after suffering physical, mental and sexual abuse.
item.itunes:keywords: domestic abuse, sexual abuse, physical abuse, mental abuse, mental health, ptsd

item.title: Episode 7 - A Tough Week
item.itunes:author: Simon Buckden
item.itunes:subtitle: Simon's PTSD takes him to a very low point but he manages 1 of the 2 planned marathons this week
item.itunes:summary: Follow Simon on Facebook and Twitter via www.raceto100.co.uk. In this week's episode Simon talks emotionally about why he had to miss one of the two marathons planned. We have an interview with a massage / touch therapist specialising in PTSD and we have a new weekly feature - Simon's Stars
item.itunes:keywords: massage, touch therapy, first marathon, newcastle marathon, twitter, facebook, trauma, mental health, injury, help for heroes, ptsd, marathon, running, endurance, jogging, training

item.title: Episode 6 - Marathon 34
item.itunes:author: Simon Buckden
item.itunes:subtitle: Festival of Pride, Cooking with Rosemary Shrager, Marathon News, Listener's Races, PTSD Sleep Problems, Listener's Questions and Twiffic Tweets.
item.itunes:summary: Follow Simon on Facebook and Twitter via www.raceto100.co.uk. Simon spent the weekend at the Festival of Pride where he was on stage cooking with celebrity chef Rosemary Shrager and then ran around the grounds for Marathon 34 of 100. We have an interview with Laura Steward who suffers from depression and talks bravely about how running helps her. We have the winner of the caption competition and the result of last weeks poll.
item.itunes:keywords: barefoot, podiatrist, amsterdam marathon, twitter, facebook, trauma, mental health, injury, help for heroes, ptsd, marathon, running, endurance, jogging, training

item.title: Episode 5 - Marathon 33
item.itunes:author: Simon Buckden
item.itunes:subtitle: Amsterdam Marathon, Marathon News, Listener's Races, KT Tape, PTSD Hypervigilance, Listener's Questions.
item.itunes:summary: Follow Simon on Facebook and Twitter via www.raceto100.co.uk. Simon ran the Amsterdam Marathon as 33 of 100 taped up with KT Tape. He talks frankly about Hypervigilance, one of the many PTSD symptoms, Chris enters his first marathon and continues his barefoot running experiment.
item.itunes:keywords: barefoot, podiatrist, amsterdam marathon, twitter, facebook, trauma, mental health, injury, help for heroes, ptsd, marathon, running, endurance, jogging, training

item.title: Episode 4 - Marathon 32
item.itunes:author: Simon Buckden
item.itunes:subtitle: Liverpool Marathon, Help for Heroes award, marathon news, PTSD, rant and rave, poems, listener's questions.
item.itunes:summary: Follow Simon on Facebook and Twitter via www.raceto100.co.uk. Simon ran the Liverpool Marathon as 32 of 100 and received an award from Help for Heroes. He talks frankly about flashbacks, one of the many PTSD symptoms + the usual favourites.
item.itunes:keywords: liverpool marathon, twitter, facebook, trauma, mental health, injury, help for heroes, ptsd, marathon, running, endurance, jogging, training

item.title: Episode 3 - A Bad Week!
item.itunes:author: Simon Buckden
item.itunes:subtitle: It's a long one! Injury and frustration, marathon news, PTSD, rant and rave, listener's questions.
item.itunes:summary: Follow Simon on Facebook and Twitter via www.raceto100.co.uk. It's not been a good week for Simon for a number of reasons. Find out why and his plans for the next marathon. We introduce a new weekly section on PTSD as well as the usual favourites.
item.itunes:keywords: loch ness marathon, twitter, facebook, injury, help for heroes, ptsd, marathon, running, endurance, jogging, training

item.title: Episode 2 - Marathon 31 of 100
item.itunes:author: Simon Buckden
item.itunes:subtitle: What have we been up to this week? Simon's last marathon, his next, marathon news, rant and rave, listener's questions.
item.itunes:summary: Follow Simon on Facebook and Twitter via www.raceto100.co.uk. Episode 2 sees us trying to improve on the podcast format and includes a lot more marathon related news and views as well as a rundown on what Simon has been up to in the last week.
item.itunes:keywords: help for heroes, ptsd, marathon, running, endurance, jogging, training

item.title: Episode 1 - All about Simon and the 100 Marathons Challenge
item.itunes:author: Simon Buckden
item.itunes:subtitle: Simon tells us a bit about himself and what motivated him to take on such an amazing challenge.
item.itunes:summary: Follow Simon on Facebook and Twitter via www.raceto100.co.uk. Simon tells us about his battle with Post Traumatic Stress Disorder (PTSD) and what motivated him to run 100 marathons in 100 weeks and to raise money for Help For Heroes
item.itunes:keywords: help for heroes, ptsd, marathon, running, endurance,
